member.name: M:PortableRest.TypeExtensions.IsSimpleType(System.Type)
member.summary: Determine whether a type is simple (String, Decimal, DateTime, etc) or complex (i.e. custom class with public properties and methods).

member.name: T:PortableRest.ParameterEncoding
member.summary: Specifies how a body paremeter should be encoded before transmission.

member.name: M:PortableRest.PortableRestException.#ctor
member.summary: A clean instance of the PortableRestException.
member.remarks: You should probably pass more information than this constructor allows.

member.name: M:PortableRest.PortableRestException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: An instance of PortableRestException that passes along a human-readable message.
member.param: A human-readable message to pass back to the developer.

member.name: M:PortableRest.PortableRestException.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: An instance of PortableRestException that passes along a human-readable message, along with the node causing the problem.
member.param: A human-readable message to pass back to the developer.
The contents of the XmlReader at the time of the exception.

member.name: M:PortableRest.PortableRestException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: An instance of PortableRestException that passes along a human-readable message, along with the original Exception thrown by the Serializer.
member.param: A human-readable message to pass back to the developer.
The Exception thrown by the Serializer.

member.name: M:PortableRest.PortableRestException.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: An instance of PortableRestException that passes along a human-readable message, along with the node causing the problem, and the original Exception thrown by the Serializer.
member.param: A human-readable message to pass back to the developer.
The contents of the XmlReader at the time of the exception.
The Exception thrown by the Serializer.
member.remarks: This is the instance that will typically be thrown on a serialization error.

member.name: P:PortableRest.PortableRestException.XmlReaderContents
member.summary: The contents of the XmlReader at the time of the exception.
member.remarks: This can help you figure out what node is causing the problem with Serialization, as DataCOntractSerializer does not provide this information by default.

member.name: T:PortableRest.RestClient
member.summary: Base client to create REST requests and process REST responses. Uses as the underlying transport.

member.name: M:PortableRest.RestClient.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the RestClient class.

member.name: M:PortableRest.RestClient.AddHeader(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a header for a given string key and string value.
member.param: The header to add.
The value of the header being added.

member.name: M:PortableRest.RestClient.SetUserAgent``1(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the for this client in a standardized format using a Type from your client library.
member.param: Optional. The name you want displayed for this Client. If left blank, it will default to the AssemblyTitleAttribute value from the AssemblyInfo file.
member.typeparam: A type from your Client Library that can be used to get the assembly information.
member.remarks: This will set the to "YourAssemblyName Major.Minor.Revision (PortableRest Major.Minor.Revision)

member.name: M:PortableRest.RestClient.ExecuteAsync``1(PortableRest.RestRequest)
member.summary: Executes an asynchronous request to the given resource and deserializes the response to an object of T.
member.param: The RestRequest to execute.

member.name: M:PortableRest.RestClient.Transform(System.Xml.Linq.XNode,PortableRest.RestRequest)
member.summary: Helps deal with the fact that the XmlSerializer is not supported, and the DataContractSerializer hates XmlAttributes.

member.name: P:PortableRest.RestClient.BaseUrl
member.summary: The base URL for the resource this client will access.

member.name: P:PortableRest.RestClient.DateFormat
member.summary: The format to be used when serializing and deserializing dates.

member.name: P:PortableRest.RestClient.UserAgent
member.summary: The User Agent string to pass back to the API.

member.name: P:PortableRest.RestClient.Headers
member.summary: A list of KeyValuePairs that will be appended to the Headers collection for all requests.

member.name: T:PortableRest.RestRequest
member.summary: Specifies the parameters for the HTTP request that will be executed against a given resource.

member.name: M:PortableRest.RestRequest.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new RestRequest instance, assuming the request will be an HTTP GET.

member.name: M:PortableRest.RestRequest.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new RestRequest instance for a given Resource.
member.param: The specific resource to access.

member.name: M:PortableRest.RestRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.Net.Http.HttpMethod)
member.summary: Creates a new RestRequest instance for a given Resource and Method.
member.param: The specific resource to access.
The HTTP method to use for the request.

member.name: M:PortableRest.RestRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.Net.Http.HttpMethod,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new RestRequest instance for a given Resource and Method, specifying whether or not to ignore the root object in the response.
member.param: The URL format string of the resource to request.
The for the request.
Whether or not the root object from the response should be ignored.

member.name: M:PortableRest.RestRequest.AddHeader(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds an Header to only this specific request.
member.remarks: Use this if you have an authentication token that times out on a regular basis.

member.name: M:PortableRest.RestRequest.AddParameter(System.Object)
member.summary: Adds an unnamed parameter to the body of the request.
member.remarks: Use this method if you're not using UrlFormEncoded requests.

member.name: M:PortableRest.RestRequest.AddParameter(System.String,System.Object,PortableRest.ParameterEncoding)
member.summary: Adds a parameter to the body of the request, to be encoded with the specified format.
member.param: For ByteArrays or Base64, this needs to be a Stream, or an exception will be thrown when the request is executed.
member.remarks: Note: If the ContentType is anything other than UrlFormEncoded, only the first Parameter will be serialzed to the request body.

member.name: M:PortableRest.RestRequest.AddUrlSegment(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Replaces tokenized segments of the URL with a desired value.
member.example: If Resource = "{entity}/Samples.aspx" and someVariable.Publisher = "Disney";, then Resource.AddUrlSegment("entity", someVariable.Publisher); becomes Resource = "Disney/Samples.aspx";

member.name: M:PortableRest.RestRequest.AddQueryString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Appends a key/value pair to the end of the existing QueryString in a URI.
member.param: The string key to append to the QueryString.
The string value to append to the QueryString.

member.name: M:PortableRest.RestRequest.AddQueryString(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Appends a key/value pair to the end of the existing QueryString in a URI.
member.param: The string key to append to the QueryString.
The value to append to the QueryString (we will call .ToString() for you).

member.name: P:PortableRest.RestRequest.ContentType
member.summary: The of the request.

member.name: P:PortableRest.RestRequest.IgnoreRootElement
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the root element in the response.

member.name: P:PortableRest.RestRequest.IgnoreXmlAttributes
member.summary: When , specifies whether or not attributes should be ignored.

member.name: P:PortableRest.RestRequest.Method
member.summary: The HTTP method to use for the request.

member.name: P:PortableRest.RestRequest.Resource
member.summary: A string representation of the specific resource to access, using ASP.NET MVC-like replaceable tokens.

member.name: P:PortableRest.RestRequest.ReturnRawString
member.summary: Tells the RestClient to skip deserialization and return the raw result.

The segment value.
